subject: Real Estate
title: CDOs: The Toxic Packaging
description: A 60-second lesson on CDOs: The Toxic Packaging.

hook.text: Wall Street took thousands of risky mortgages, sliced them up, and rated the top slices as AAA â€” safe.

buildup.text: Collateralized Debt Obligations bundled mortgage risk into layers. Senior layers got paid first.

discovery.text: Rating agencies gave top-tier CDO tranches the same safety grade as U.S. government bonds.

twist.text: When defaults rose, even senior tranches collapsed. The diversification that was supposed to reduce risk didn't.

climax.text: CDOs turned local housing risk into a global contagion that no investor could escape.

punchline.text: Chopping up bad debt doesn't make it good.

quiz.question: Why did senior CDO tranches fail despite high ratings?
